oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Effect of achiral and mixed chiral ligands on the asymmetric synthesis of γ-nitrophosphonates via Michael addition
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: RAI, VISHAL
NAMBOOTHIRI, IRISHI NN
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: enantioselectivity
stereoselectivity
catalysts
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Change in the diastereo- and/or enantioselectivity were observed when the Li–cinchonine catalyzed conjugate addition of phosphonates to nitroalkenes was carried out in the presence of achiral/chiral additives. Although the conjugate addition in the absence of such additives proceeded in better yields and selectivities as reported previously, the dramatic change in selectivity in the presence of additives provides an opportunity to synthesize different stereoisomers of the product, γ-nitrophosphonate, using primarily the same chiral source.
